intro: Quercus turbinata, commonly known as the turban oak, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, turbinate-shaped acorns and lobed, serrated leaves. The tree typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and has a broad, rounded crown. Its bark is thick and scaly, providing protection against pests and environmental stress. The plant plays an important role in local ecosystems, offering habitat and food for various wildlife species.
